channel.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
channel.description:
Video announcing the steam big picture mode was just released! - [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFrL6-OhN94']LINK[/url]
Can finally use steam on the big screen in a new slick UI. Also the video has a tip of the hat to the blackmesa greenlight [url='https://www.reddit.com/r/gaming/comments/zeewr/come_on_rgaming_we_can_do_this/']as this is the link[/url] they click on when they are browsing reddit.

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.description:
Every other console needs to emulate this typing style.

item.description:
rorriMAesU:

Out of everything on reddit, valve chose to hover over a thread concerning BM. I do not think that is coincidence.

The video even showed it being “clicked”

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
I’ve been using steam on a large HD in my bedroom for a while now, and for some reason when I saw the video about Big Picture, I assumed they were working on some sort of Valve-console to play PC games in your living room.

Now that I understand what this is, it’s really no change for me, but it might make me start using my gamepad more…

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: Vibez
item.description:
netham45:

Greenlight isn’t rendering properly in it for me.
https://i.imgur.com/nMyAP.png

Edit: Seems to do that on every page, some sort of buffer at the top and bottom.

That’s made on purpose. Same thing happens if you scroll to the bottom of the page. It’s for convenience - you can read top and the bottom in the very middle of your TV

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
So I’m remote into my media centre at home, and it seems to be running well enough. I may have to install an ad block feature as I haven’t got it enabled in my router at the moment. Some of the pop ups are annoying when in a mobile browser.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
Yeah, I mostly just like the convenience of a console with the performance of a PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
sudpuzzer:

but you also get the added comfort of lounging on the couch rather than hunched in a chair.

I don’t have a great chair or anything like that, but it’s decent enough that I can basically lay back and almost sit on it like a couch, so this isn’t as much of a problem for me

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
I just hope this encourages split screen play, a feature that I feel most modern pc games are missing. Hell even console games are starting to abandon it with the developers citing hard where limitations.

Sent from my phone using Tapatalk

Read full topic

item.description: Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
Another obvious plus for playing PC games on your TV rather than console games is the post-processing available to high-end PC users, like AA and whatnot. Space Marine runs at a buttery smooth high framerate and looks much better than it’s 360 counterpart, but you also get the added comfort of lounging on the couch rather than hunched in a chair.

Big Picture mode definitely has its uses.

My only problem now is that I have to choose between playing on the big screen, or playing in SLI Surround

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Ironic, that Valve would make a really good controller interface that seems to be better then existing console designs, for a PC.

Somebody in the youtube comments asked if plugging it into the TV would make steam run his games better then his mac does :lol:

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
So, I love Big Picture mode. I just went out and bought a wired 360 controller to plug into my PC and loaded up steam on the 40 inch to play some Space Marine. It’s really cool. Obviously I will only be using it to play ‘controller friendly’ games such as Space Marine, Just Cause 2, etc. So far, I really like the wheel keyboard thing and the internet browser. I think I actually like the whole thing better than the Xbox dashboard…

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Does the browser inside of it seem really fast to anyone else, or is it just me?
If this had a more user friendly tab system I’d leave the Steam client a lot less.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
You can get decent typing speeds on that type of keyboard. My psp had something called the danzeff keyboard in several homebrew programs. It made the IM’ing application usable. Once you become proficient in it I equate its speed to about that of writing. Not super fast but never feels frustratingly slow like the normal onscreen keyboard.

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
sersoft:

“the whole thing is designed with controllers in mind” I stopped watching there.

I already have the perfect UI for mouse and keyboard, am not gonna switch to gay console-wannabe UI just because my living room TV is big.

never change

Read full topic
item.source: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)

item.title: Steam Big Picture (+ tip of the hat to BM)
item.dc:creator: Lost
item.description:
Maxey:

That daisywheel thing is pretty damn clever. With some practice you can type stuff with the controller pretty quickly. Much better than the virtual keyboard thing that consoles use right now.

Agreed! Bout time someone reinvented the wheel (no pun intended).

Read full topic
